title: 104_hr67
content: The Act titled "Conservation Reserve Program Reform Act of 1995" extends the Environmental Conservation Acreage Reserve Program. SEC. 2. The Environmental Conservation Acreage Reserve Program is extended by amending various provisions of the Food Security Act of 1985 to replace "1995" with "2005". Additionally, the Wetlands Reserve Program is amended by changing "2000" to "2005". SEC. 3. Authority is granted to modify or extend contracts. SEC. 3. Authority to modify or extend contracts under the Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to allow conversion of land subject to contract to other uses. Prior to or upon the expiration of a contract for environmentally sensitive land, the Secretary shall extend or modify the contract to help owners and operators comply with the applicable plan. Owners and operators with existing contracts can choose to modify or extend their contracts under this subchapter. The Secretary can remove land from conservation reserve before contract expiration if it is not highly erodible cropland, classified as certain soil classes, and covered by an approved conservation plan. Before the expiration of the contract, land in the conservation reserve can be replaced with more environmentally sensitive land owned by the same owner. Land can also be re-enrolled for up to 10 years if it remains planted with permanent cover for conservation purposes and does not contribute to excessive erosion. Before the contract expires, land in the conservation reserve can be replaced with more environmentally sensitive land owned by the same owner. Negotiations can be entered into for reduced annual rental payments in exchange for limited land uses. Upon contract expiration, cropland bases can be retained or transferred to other lands. The production adjustment program allows for land to be replaced with more environmentally sensitive land before the contract expires. Annual rental payments for re-enrolled or limited-use land are limited to 80% of the original payment. Amendments are made to ensure compliance with the program. The Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to rename the technical committee to conservation review committee and make changes to the State committee composition. The Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to rename the technical committee to conservation review committee and make changes to the State committee composition. Additionally, there are demonstration projects outlined in Section 4. The Secretary of Agriculture may grant producers of agricultural commodities the authority to retain or enroll land in the conservation reserve for growing grass or raising legumes. The Secretary is limited to selecting 3 sites per State for these grants. Evaluation must be done within 3 years after the first grant is awarded. The Secretary of Agriculture can grant producers the authority to use land for conservation purposes. Within 3 years of the first grant, an evaluation of economic and environmental effects must be submitted to Congress. Up to $500,000 is authorized for grants each fiscal year from 1996 to 1998.
